item.title: Formulating a Fantastic Thesis
item.dc:creator: Chris Pondoc
item.description: The thesis is often thought of to be the most important component to any writing piece. While I personally don’t believe in “formulas” when it comes to subjective competitions such as National History Day, I do believe that the template below serves as a great structure for crafting a strong thesis:

item.title: Picking a Great Topic
item.dc:creator: Chris Pondoc
item.description: Finding a great topic can be hard for a lot of National History Day participants. This is especially when your team has numerous interests that stretch a variety of fields. Regardless, there are three key tenets you should stick to when choosing a great topic.

item.title: The Things that No One Can Imagine
item.dc:creator: Chris Pondoc
item.description: Written originally for my high school newspaper.

item.title: A Potpourri of Project Tips
item.dc:creator: Chris Pondoc
item.description: With students getting ready to turn their ideas and notes into a polished project, I offer a couple of tips to help guide your work.
